title: How the Homeless Population in New York City Breaks Down?
description: This estimate splits the approximately 120,500 homeless people in NYC into major groups based on health, family status, work ability, and arrival history. These figures help focus solutions toward the right needs. Percentages and numbers are based on HUD, NYC DHS, and Comptroller reports.

rows.estimation_method: Estimated using 18% rate of serious mental illness or chronic disability among homeless individuals.

sources.text: Coalition for the Homeless - Basic Facts 2024

rows.estimation_method: Families account for approximately 40–45% of the NYC sheltered population, based on DHS daily census.
Single adults without major disabilities estimated at around 20–22% based on DHS daily shelter breakdowns.
Homeless youth estimated at around 1–2% of the total based on RHY shelter data.
Based on Comptroller reports showing ~35% of NYC shelter occupants are migrants housed in HERRC centers.
